name: Kepler-183
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-183 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-183 is a star with 0.887 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located 3530.96 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-183 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-183 b

Kepler-183 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.69 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-183.

The mass of Kepler-183 b is 5.47 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-183 b is 2.06 that of Earth. At 5.47 Earth masses, Kepler-183 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-183 c

Kepler-183 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.64 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-183.

The mass of Kepler-183 c is 6.92 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-183 c is 2.27 that of Earth. At 6.92 Earth masses, Kepler-183 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-183, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
